item.title: Trump never took presidency 'seriously,' says former US President Obama
item.description: Barack Obama, America's first black president, will use his Democratic convention speech Wednesday to brand President Donald Trump as someone who never took his office seriously, putting US democracy in danger.

item.title: Global COVID-19 cases are more than 22.1M, death toll rises to 781,194 with at least 13,874,900 recoveries
item.description: At least 22,187,780 cases of coronavirus have been registered in 196 countries and territories. Of these, at least 13,874,900 are now considered recovered andÂ at least 781,194 people have died since it emerged in China late last year, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Wednesday.

item.title: COVID-19 vaccine won't be mandatory in US, says Fauci
item.description: Anthony Fauci, the United States' top infectious diseases official, said Wednesday the government wouldn't make any future COVID-19 vaccine obligatory for the general public -- though local jurisdictions could make it mandatory for some groups, like children.

item.title: Maersk oil tanker caught at sea off Malta after rescuing 27 migrants
item.description: A Maersk oil tanker has been anchored off the coast of Malta for two weeks after rescuing 27 migrants, including a child and a pregnant woman, with authorities in Malta and Tunisia denying the vessel entry, the company said on Wednesday.

item.title: Bahrain cancels home self-isolation protocol for those entering the country
item.description: Bahrain announced on Wednesday it would end a protocol that required all those arriving in the country to self-isolate at home for 10 days regardless of the outcome of testing, its health ministry said in a statement on Wednesday.

item.title: US officially notifies Hong Kong it has ended three agreements - State Dept
item.description: The US State Department said it notified Hong Kong on Wednesday that Washington has suspended or terminated three bilateral agreements with the semi-autonomous city following China's imposition of a sweeping national security law.

item.title: Isdang opah o moonfish na bihirang magpakita, nahuli sa Samar matapos ang lindol sa Masbate
item.description: Isang malaking opah o moonfish na bihirang magpakita dahil laging nasa kailaliman ng dagat ang nahuli ng isang mangingisda sa Oras, Eastern Samar.

item.title: Fear, rumors lead to hundreds of attacks on COVID-19 responders
item.description: Healthcare workers fighting coronavirus in dozens of countries are facing violence from fearful communities who have attacked doctors and burned down clinics, aid agencies said on Tuesday.

item.title: Marinduque residents alarmed over 'dog execution order'
item.description: Residents of a barangay in Buenavista, Marinduque on Wednesday expressed their anger after their dogs were killed by authorities based on an execution order issued by the local government.

item.title: HPG cops scold PUV drivers for passengers without face shields
item.description: Operatives of the PNP-Highway Patrol Group (HPG) on Wednesday scolded and gave tickets to public utility vehicle drivers that who had passengers not wearing face shields amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Dahil sa lockdown, OFW sa KSA hindi nakauwi nang pumanaw ang mister
item.description: Labis ang pagdadalamhati ng isang OFW sa Saudi Arabia nang hindi siya makauwi sa bansa nang pumanaw ang kaniyang mister dahil sa umiiral na lockdown. Bukod pa doon, inaalala rin niya ang kalagayan ng naiwan nilang tatlong anak.

item.title: PNP eyes non-lethal weapons after Jolo incident, Ragos shooting
item.description: There are suggestions na mayroong pepper spray, mayroong taser gun, may baton, and then firearm so that logically a police officer would have different options," Gamboa said. "Kung wala ang options na 'yun, 'yung nga, after the persuasion, kung hindi [gagana], the possible option would be firearm."

item.title: Budget for cash-for-work, transport sector slashed in Bayanihan 2 bicam, says Marcos
item.description: The funds for some sectors needing assistance amid the economic crisis have been decreased in the proposed P162-billion Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or Bayanihan 2 in a bid to cover other needs, according to Senator Imee Marcos on Wednesday.

item.title: AFP chief Gapay convinced there was 'coverup' in Jolo shooting
item.description: Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) chief Lieutenant General Gilbert Gapay on Wednesday said there had been a coverup in the Jolo shooting incident wherein four soldiers died in the hands of police officers.

item.title: Bipartisan majority of Americans want more money for Postal Service --poll
item.description: A bipartisan majority of Americans want the government to spend more money on the US Postal Service, and most agree that mail delivery will be a vital part of the November election, a Reuters/Ipsos public opinion poll released on Wednesday found.
